Reflections on the Graduation of 2020:

A few of us were able to great every student and family at the front gate. Everyone was cheerful and willing to go with the flow of temperature checks and waiting in line.
I was also able to view the entire graduation ceremony from the sidelines. It was well orchestrated and fun to see each shop exit their cars and walk across the stage.
Thank you Brian Spadifino for your vision and commitment to make a meaningful graduation for this class. It was clear how much families and students appreciated it.

It almost looked like we knew what we were doing! It was a nice send off for this class. Thanks for everything. Have a great weekend!

Good morning.

Last night, the School Committee voted to cancel April break and shorten the end of the year by four days. Our last day was scheduled to be on June 18. The last day will now be on Friday, June 12th. The School Committee took into account the survey that was done by the association in making the decision. They also wanted to avoid a disruption in distance learning, since it has just launched.

Monday, April 20th is Patriots Day and will still be a day off. We will keep the same Tuesday-Thursday schedule, but move Monday to Friday. Therefore, English, SS, PE/Health, and shop will move their Monday Office Hours and assignments to Friday.

Hopefully. things will get closer to normal in June and getting out early will be good for us, our students, and the economy! Have a great day and keep up the good work!

Respectfully,
Brian Spadafino
Principal
